ovdesc.p: This table is used to define the posting line of Payment

desc.p: Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each posting line created.
Validation Rules:
35 numeric characters.
The retrieved Posting set Id has a list of posting lines associated with it. This is the Foreign KEY for this Table.
Validation Rules:
35 numeric characters.
Specifies the order of the posting lines within the posting set.
As a Posting Set can have multiple posting lines, Sequence Number is used to order the posting lines within the Posting Set.
Validation Rules:
7 numeric characters.

Indicates whether the posting line is a debit or a credit posting line . Even for the posting line where charges are taken from a credit party , the party flag for the charge posting in PPL_Posting line will be "D" as the charges are getting debited for the party.
Possible values:
D: Debit Party
C: Credit Party
Indicates the payment related account used in the posting line.
Validation Rules:
20 alphanumeric characters. Value links to field 'AccountToken' in PPT.ACCOUNTTOKEN.
Indicates the payment related amount used in the posting line.
Validation Rules:
20 alphanumeric characters. Value links to field 'AccountToken' in PPT.ACCOUNTTOKEN.
Indicates the overriding booking codes which will supersede the booking codes derived from product determination process in the payments hub.
Booking codes are usually based on the type of posting. ie. Principal posting, charges posting or VAT posting.
Validation Rules:
10 alphanumeric characters.
Indicates the date on which the booking was performed in the ledger.
Validation Rules:
20 alphanumeric characters. Value links to field 'DateToken' in PPT.DATETOKEN.
Indicates the date on which the booking was performed in the ledger.
Validation Rules:
20 alphanumeric characters. Value links to field 'DateToken' in PPT.DATETOKEN.
Indicates if the posting line has to be displayed if the amount value
of the amount token result in zero.
Possible values:
N: Display the posting line even when the value of amount token is zero.
Y: Do not display the posting line when the value of amount token is zero
Validation Rules:
1 character.
Indicates the generic statement format attached to the posting line.
For the principal debit and credit accounts, if the client or bank have
mentioned a special statement format name in client conditions or Bank
conditions then statement lines attached to that statement format need to be displayed for the principal posting.
If the debit side of the payment contains the field DebitStatementFormat or
credit side contains the field CreditStatementFormat set then it indicates that the side would like to have customised statement lines.
This field should be checked twice (Debit side and Credit Side)
Validation Rules:
30 alphanumeric character.Value links to field 'StatementFormatID' in PPT.STATEMENTFORMAT
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
